III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond
Description with the institution’s purpose and the needs of the residents
and shall assure the continual safety, protection, and direct
care and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth parent reported that on 10/19/2023, her daughter’s neck
was sucked by another youth at the facility. Staff are aware what
happened.
Investigation This complaint was received on 10/27/2023 via online agency
complaint.
An email notification was sent to PREA Specialist on 10/30/2023.
I interviewed Complainant on 10/30/2023 via telephone, they
reported no additional information.
I interviewed Director on 10/30/2023 at the facility. Director
reported Youth A has been at the facility for 3 months. He said on
10/16/2023 Youth A was in the classroom with 4 other youths with
one staff member. He said Youth A had reported to staff later in
the day that Youth B had sucked her neck. Youth A was examined
by the nurse and there was no marks or bruises. Video footage
was reviewed of the incident it could not be determined what was
alleged occurred. After that incident Youth A and B did not have
any contact. There are no prior incidents involving Youth A or
Youth B. Youth B was discharged from the facility on 10/18/2023.
I interviewed Youth A on 10/30/2023 at the facility. Youth A has
been at the facility for 4 months. She reported that on 10/16/23,
she and four other youths were in the classroom with a staff
member. She said Youth B came up to her, bent her head down
close to Youth A’s ear, and sucked on Youth A’s neck. Initially
Youth A thought Youth B was going to whisper something in her
ear. Youth A said there was a staff member supervising, but staff
didn’t see the incident. Youth A reported the incident to staff and
was examined by the nurse. Youth A said she didn’t have any
contact with Youth B after this incident. Youth A reported feeling
safe and didn’t express any other concerns.
2

I interviewed Staff 1 on 10/30/2023 at the facility. Staff 1 is a
Youth Specialist. Staff 1 recalled the incident and reported he was
in the classroom with Youth A and four other youths. He said he
didn’t see the incident but heard about it from Youth A. He said he
had was looking away when this is alleged to have happened, so
he didn’t see Youth B suck Youth A’s neck. He said he was
looking away for only a few seconds.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 10/30/2023 at the facility. Staff 2 is a
Youth Specialist and has been working at the facility for 9 years.
Staff 2 reported on 10/16/2023, he was in the control room outside
the classroom monitoring the camera and he saw Youth B walk
over to Youth A and bend her head close to Youth A’s ear. He
immediately went to the classroom and told Youth B to go back to
her seat. He did not see Youth B suck or touch Youth A’s neck.
He said Youth B told him that she was whispering something to
Youth A. He said later in the evening Youth A reported that Youth
B brushed her face against Youth A’s neck.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 10/30/2023 via telephone. Staff 3 is a
supervisor and has been working at the facility for 25 years. He
reviewed the incident report written by Staff 1. He said Youth A
and Youth B were separated after the incident and didn’t have any
contact. He said Youth A was examined by the nurse and there
was no bruise or mark on her neck.
I interviewed Youth B on 11/15/2023 via telephone. Youth B
confirmed her DOB and that she was previously placed at the
facility. Youth B was discharged from the facility on 10/18/2023.
Youth B recalled the incident in the classroom with Youth A. Youth
B denied sucking or doing anything inappropriate to Youth A.
Youth B said she went up close to Youth A to whisper something
in her ear. Youth B said she was at the facility for one month and
didn’t have any issues or concerns with other youths or staff.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from the evening of 10/16/2023 was reviewed on
10/30/2023 (Note: there is no audio). Youth A was viewed sitting
at a desk in the classroom with four other Youths and one staff
member. Each youth is sitting at a desk, and the staff member is
sitting at the desk approximately 4 feet away from the youths.
Youth B walks over to Youth A, who was sitting and bends down
close to Youth A’s ear for approximately two seconds, and then
walks back to her desk. Staff 2 comes in and talks to Youth B and
Youth A.
3

Documents Reviewed:
• Facility’s policy on Staff to resident ratio and supervision.
The ratio of direct care staff to youth residing in detention
will be a minimum of one staff to eight residents.
• Incident report dated 10/16/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Youth A reported Youth B made her feel uncomfortable
because she thinks Youth B is gay. She reported Youth B
kissed her on the neck.
• Youth A was examined by the nurse on 10/17/2023 and her
neck exam was normal; no bruises or open skin found.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no supporting
evidence Youth B sucked Youth A’s neck and there is no concern
for staff supervision.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

Rule Code & R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
Section staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/02/2023 staff saw Youth A naked in the shower
Investigation Additional allegation came in on 10/31/2023 regarding the same
youth. Complainant noted that a male staff member saw Youth A
naked in the shower. The agency had informed DCWL almost two
weeks prior to the allegation coming in that they had been
informed of this concern and had already assessed the complaint.
Chief Administrator emailed DCWL Consultant on 10/19/2023 the
following:
Youth A’s parent complained a male staff member saw her
daughter naked while in the shower. The young lady did not
make us directly aware of this, however after getting the
complaint from her mother we met with her. She didn’t
specifically identify the employee by name, but we were
able to pinpoint a timeframe to review cameras. I was able
to confirm that there was a physical management a few feet
away from the shower area. There were approximately 7-8
employees in/around the area, some male. I cannot confirm
if anyone saw her naked, only that there was quite a bit of
movement in the area. At one point a male employee does
walk down the hall past the shower. However, I do not
know what he saw because there are walls for privacy. The
same employee stood in a fixed position near the showers
for a minute or two. To be thorough, Director and I went
upstairs to reenact the situation (…I went in the shower and
Director stood where the employee was). Director could not
see me from that spot when I was in the shower stall and I
would estimate I am close to the same size as this young
lady.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 11/15/2023 via telephone. Staff 3 recalled
on 10/02/2023, he and several staff were responding to a situation
involving another Youth. Staff 3 said he walked past the shower
area but denied seeing Youth A in shower. He reported the
shower area has a wall, so the shower area is not visible.
5

Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no supporting
evidence that Staff 3 saw Youth A naked. The agency had
informed DCWL prior to the allegation coming in that they had
been informed of this concern and had already assessed the
complaint thoroughly. The facility completed an internal
investigation and determined staff could not have possibly seen
into the shower area.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
